weather_report:
Evanston is currently experiencing a chilly night, with temperatures hovering in the mid to upper teens, accompanied by a gentle breeze from the west. The atmosphere feels quite crisp, with a noticeable bite to the air that encourages bundling up if venturing outside. Though the sky is partly cloudy, it offers glimpses of stars twinkling through the clouds, presenting a serene yet stark winter tableau by the lake.

As we look ahead to the day, Friday promises to turn brighter with mostly sunny skies prevailing. Temperatures will climb notably, reaching into the low 30s, as a brisk west-southwest wind stirs the air. While there's no precipitation expected, the conditions may generate some gentle waves on Lake Michigan, perfect for an invigorating winter stroll along the beach. Recommended attire would include warm layers—sweaters and jackets—along with a scarf and gloves to guard against the chill. Despite the winter season, the forecasted temperatures align reasonably with what one would expect in early December, making it a good day for outdoor enthusiasts to explore local parks or simply enjoy the scenic beauty of the lakeshore.
